The Italian Irredentist movement strove for the transfer to the Kingdom of Italy of all territories in the immediate vicinity of the Kingdom which were largely or partly seen as populated by ethnic Italians. Not only did this include claims to Venetian lands in Italy proper, but it also meant territorial ambitions further into Dalmatia.
Construct Italy
With the downfall of Aragon as a Great Power we have gained a very good possibility to fill the power vacuum in Italy through helping the Grand Duchy of Savoy to gain the Iron Crown.
Etrurian Manifesto

The evil imperialist swines decided to cut their knives through our country and create borders of their own. People of Italy, here me calling! We shall unite and free our brothers in one glorious revolutionary march! For Freedom!
Council of Italy

With the recent flourishing of Liberal ideas, the time is ripe for us to unite Italy. We shall call a council of Italian states to further the cause for a united Italy free of foreign influence. If the council is successful, we will be able to bring Italy into this new age of Liberalism and Industry.
The heart of the Revolution

Germany was the heart of the Revolution but alas the old Republican flame is nowhere to be seen across the Alpes. Our Republic has the duty of helping our fellow revolutionaries to have a solid ally in the North! We need to pay caution though since it will surely not be to the liking of Burgundy and Bohemia...
Build the Ponte della Liberta

Venice has benefited from most of its history of being an island. But the changes of our modern world and the advance of the railways have rendered Venice quite isolated from other urban centres. We could boost immigration by creating a bridge linking the City of the Doges to the rest of Europe.
Risanamento

Many urban centres underwent great transformations in the XIXth century to improve hygiena and salubrity along with building the necessary facilities for the modern life. Venice is in fact in dire needs of a great restoration, aimed at negating the problems of being an island city, surrounded by water and marshes. Some of our monuments could also be improved to reflect our international standing.
Improving the Arsenal

The Arsenal of Venice was the biggest shipyard in Europe for centuries, helping Venice to secure the Mediterranean with its galleys. Nowadays the days of the galleys are over but we could change the Arsenal into a Modern Shipyard, helping us to secure the Mediterranean and our overseas possessions!
Integration of Athesia

The Colony of Athesia and Eleuthera has had a complicated relationship with the metropolis. It was thanks to Venice that settlers were defended from the Seminole tribes and could develop the peninsula and the archipelago to its current level but the need for reform was not acknowledged and insurrections tore the trust between Athesians and Venice. However our continued hold on Athesiahave allowed us to make our rule accepted by the locals.
Integration of Dalmatia

Dalmatia was the first target of expansion of the Republic in the XIIth century, and Venice has held onto it for despite the various Turkish wars. Recently the independence of Illiria had led to increased nationalism from the Croatian inhabitants but despite this our rule has been confirmed.
Restore the order in Korea
The Korean rebellion is finally crushed and our peaceful rule over the peninsula may continue.
Enforce peace
With Korea fully under our control, we can now enforce peace with Japan.
Conquer Korea
The Koreans and their allies defeated us last time, but now that we are better prepared it is time to resolve the issue once and for all!
The Seoul Treaty
With our expansion being so successful, we might persuade the Manchus to give up some of their territory without bloodshed.
Annex the Ainu Protectorate
As we plan to continue our colonisation efforts in the north, we should seize direct control over the Ainu territories.
The Man in the High Castle

The Chinese colonists founded the Dong Guo federation long time ago and since then it has developed into a full-fledged country. But somehow they stand in way of establishing total control over the Pacific.
Annex Hawaii
Our relationship with the Hawaiian government has borne fruit. They have asked to become a part of our nation.
Japanese Bonin
Japan now controls the archipelago, and our modern administration will get rid of Gaijin names and change them accordingly.
Japanese Formosa
Japan now controls Formosa, and our modern administration will get rid of Gaijin names and change the island accordingly.
Organizing Manchukuo

Our expansion has given us the rich lands of Manchuria. Their goods will be very important for our industry but the numerous local population could resist us. Let us establish a puppet state under the rule of a Manchu prince which will allow us to better control the local population.
Organizing Yakutia

The frozen Seihoku lands would be interesting to exploit but the lack of population and the unwilligness from our citizens to move there does not allow us to benefit fully from it, worse, these lands cost us much. We could create another Co-prosperity sphere member by 'civilizing' the Yakut tribes and then grant us sovereignty over all the inland Seihoku lands we possess.
Proclaim Yourself the Khan of Khans
Our nation, our pride - union of the Kazaks and the Uzbeks. Let the steppe eagle fly to the future, full of glory, power under Your leadership.
Reform the Grand Duchy
The Grand Duchy of Lithuania was one of the mightiest Eastern European nations. It became a part of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth. With its fall she can rise again.
The Livonian Confederation
After centuries of foreign oppression, the Baltic people are now united under our flag. Let us proclaim the Livonian Confederation, the state of all the Baltics citizens!
Restore the Macedonian Rule over Greece

In the classical era, Macedonians managed to gain control of Greece. But their empire was trashed and Macedonia subdued. Now when we have managed to reconquer what is rightfully ours, we can reform the empire of Philip of Macedon…
Rebuild the Alexander's Empire

Alexander the Great, son of Philip, managed to conquer everything between Athens and far-away India. With our rise among the Great Powers of the world, we can start thinking about rebuilding it  - starting with the conquest of the Asia Minor.
Align with the Yugoslavians
Thanks to our friendship with our northern neighbors, we are now able to abandon our absurd Greek roots and enter the land of future - South Slavia!
Hegemonia

The Conference of Naples of 1824 had given to our King the assent of both Greeks and Bulgarians to rule over Macedonia, and many in the assembly had hoped that Macedonia could also free the rest of Greece. Now an upstart rule in Athens and it is the duty of the Makedonias House to end this petty kingdom and unify Greece!
Destiny of the North
We should spread our greatness across all of northern Arcadia.
Destiny of the East
We should spread our greatness across all of eastern Arcadia.
Destiny of the South
We should spread our greatness across all of southern Arcadia.
Destiny of the West
We should spread our greatness across all of western Arcadia.
The Athesian Purchase

The Venetian colony of Athesia is located on a major strategic point. The port of Rialto watches most of ships passing through the Athesian strait and thus controls the traffic going in and out la Baie de Nouvelle-France. Since Venice has been declining lately, it might be the occasion to acquire this territory in exchange of some money
Ultimatum for Athesia
Despite our generous proposal, Venice has not let Athesia go. Now it is time to revert to force and to show them that one does not treat us like a minor power....
The Habanan purchase

With our control over the mainland established, it is time to turn our eyes to Habana. The island of Habana is the only colony that did not join Gran Colombia during the war of independence. It is one of the last Spanish holdings in the New World and it holds a strategic position. To be free from any intervention or disruption of commerce in the Gulf of Mexico, we must control the island. It will require however a large amount of cash and even that will not bind Spain to give Habana...
The Sudurhafeyjar Purchase
Scandinavia still holds the archipelago they called the Islands of the South consisting of Righavn and Ayiti. Buying these islands would strengthen even more our position in the Caribbean
The Eendrachtsland Purchase

Burgundy still holds the island of Eendrachtsland in the Caribbean. This little island does not present an importance as great as Habana or Ayiti but it would improve our standing in Arcadia even more if we acquired this island.
Buy the Falklands
We have lost the Falkland Islands to the Scandinavians and no one objected their seizure. But now they are not recognized as a Great power anymore we could offer to buy the islands for a hefty price
Dissolve the Federation

This war has shown us something. The former Spanish colonies united under the same flag are a threat to our influence in Arcadia and Ameriga. Some in our government have suggested that we make Gran Colombia dissolve itself in little states easier to control and manipulate. Thus there will only be one power in the New-World, us.
The Great White North
With our position secured in Northern Arcadia we can occupy the lands we claim in the West!
Advancing into Arcadia

The Kaiganese colony has always claimed the remote Takikawa region as her rightful lands and with Odensmark and Tangwan falling under the control of other powers it might be wise move to take this region too.
The Great North

The remote area of Takikawa was discovered by the Kaiganese at the beginning of the century but its remoteness and lack of ressources has left it empty. But now that all nearby territories are colonized it might be better for us to settle that territory!
Integration of the Kaiganese

Kita Kaigan is the neighbour with whom we share the most, a lot thanks to our common Asiatic origins. The Kaiganese though are too little and weak to protect themselves so it is better if we just annex them and integrate them.
Force our rule over Ciudad de Mexico
Because of the massive failure of the aftermath of the Independence Wars, the people of Mexico lost their unity. Shall the Mexican Eagle rise again?
Embrace Mexican unity
We can abandon the idea of united Gran Colombia and instead focus on the integration of natives living in our lands.
Form $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$
Our dominant position among our cultural brethren puts us in a position to form $CULTURE_GROUP_UNION$.
Organize Indonesia
Our colonies in the East Indies are becoming a true part of the country. We must create the proper structures, so that they stand on par with our other national states.
Claim Indonesia
Now that we have taken possession of this East Indies colony, we should reorganize its structure to make it truly part of our greater colonial administration.
Organize Christiania
Our colonies in the East Indies are becoming a true part of the country. We must create the proper structures, so that they stand on par with our other national states.
Claim Christiania
Now that we have taken possession of Christiania, we should reorganize its structure to make it truly part of our greater colonial administration.
Organize Terra d'Oro
With the Scramble for Africa launched the colony of Terra d'Oro should be formally organized to better rule over our African territories
Organize Sierra Leone

We should organize the African colonies to better reflect both a local structure, as well as set up the possibility for autonomous rule-- dominated by our benevolent colonial administrators, of course.
Claim Sierra Leone
Now that we have taken possession of this African colony, we should reorganize its structure to make it truly part of our greater colonial administration.
Create the North German League
We have now obtained a dominant position over the north German states - it is time to complete this, to better pursue the greater goal of German unity.
Proclaim the Kingdom of Hanover
For ages we've been dukes. Today, with the world recognizing us a greater power and Bremen secured, we shall proclaim the Kingdom of Hanover and lay our claim on all the German coast!
The Frisian unity

The county of Frisia, close enough to Burgundy to be threatened by and close enough the sea to fear Scandinavia, still managed to survive for centuries. The Burgundian conquests left Frisia divided, but now, Frisia will be one!
Become Westphalia
With our control over Westfalen we are able to elevate our country to the Grand Duchy of Westfalen.
Become Rhineland
Now that we defeated our former master Burgundy and acquired land on the other bank of the Rhine, we can proclaim the Kingdom of Rhineland!
Join Rhineland
A nation emerged on the other bank of the Rhine, calling itself the Rhineland. We can join them, as we occupy the other bank.
The Greater Rhineland
The Rhineland is a powerful and wealthy region. However, we only own a small part of the river that gives us our name. We must claim and secure all the Rhine, from the sources to the Rhine Delta!
Join Rhineland
A nation emerged on the other bank of the Rhine, calling itself the Rhineland. We can join them, as we occupy the other bank.
Treaty of Batavia
Batavia is under our control. Now is the time to sit down with our former colonial masters and work out a peace deal that will see it transferred back into Javanese hands.
Embrace the Ideal of Enlightenment

The time has come for our people to stop clinging to ancient tradition. We must look to the nations of the west, and embrace their technology, if we are to retain our independence and our place in the world.
Embrace the Ideal of Tradition
For too long have we looked to the nations of the west. We reject their ways and their superiority, for our are now and always have been best for us.
Embrace the Ideal of Progress
Our march towards civilization and matching any imperial nation with our ingenuity continues. We shall not be left behind!
Embrace the Ideal of Independence
We will not allow our nation to be overrun by the western imperialists. We are strong, united, and shall remain such. Against all odds, our nation shall endure.
Embrace the Ideal of Loyalty
Every citizen in our nation exists to serve, towards the greater good. It is only by acting in unison that we can hope to preserve our nation in the perilous times to come.
Embrace the Ideal of Unity
We move forward, but as a single people with a singular purpose. We shall not succumb to discord and revolution. Unity is our only hope of greatness.
Embrace the Ideal of Unity
We move forward, but as a single people with a singular purpose. We shall not succumb to discord and revolution. Unity is our only hope of greatness.
Embrace the Ideal of Prosperity
Our nation is wealthy and our people prosperous. This is and always shall be our greatest strength.
Embrace the Ideal of Prosperity
Our nation is wealthy and our people prosperous. This is and always shall be our greatest strength.
Embrace the Ideal of Glory
Ours is a great and powerful nation, possessing freedom and strength that other nations can only envy. We shall boldly stride into the future, where our greater destiny awaits.
Embrace the Ideal of Glory
Ours is a great and powerful nation, possessing freedom and strength that other nations can only envy. We shall boldly stride into the future, where our greater destiny awaits.
Embrace the Ideal of Dominion
Our nation is strong, our borders inviolate. We shall march into the future together, humbly accepting the knowledge that our nation is the envy of the entire world.
Embrace the Ideal of Dominion
Our nation is strong, our borders inviolate. We shall march into the future together, humbly accepting the knowledge that our nation is the envy of the entire world.
Embrace the ideal of Fraternity
In our country, all men are created equal. It is time we fully embrace that maxim and throw off the shackles of iniquity.
Embrace the Ideal of Freedom

Ours is a nation where all men are free to do as they wish, to advance their lot in life and achieve the greatness they were born to. This is our highest virtue, and the source of our nation's strength.
Embrace the ideal of Supremacy
Our culture is astounding. Our military might is unparalleled. Our industry is dazzling. Soon the rest of the world will know of our might, and shake as we step onto the wider stage.
Embrace the Ideal of Productivity
Ours is a wealthy nation filled with industrious, driven people. Each man pushes himself to do better, for the betterment of all.
Embrace the Ideal of Equality
It is time for our nation to change the character of our people, to encourage them to embrace the values of equality and social fairness above all else.
Embrace the Ideal of Liberty
It is time for our nation to change the character of our people, to encourage them to embrace the values of liberty and personal freedom above all else.
Embrace the Ideal of Might
It is time for our nation to change the character of our people, to encourage them to embrace the values of force and military power above all else.
Embrace the Ideal of Order
It is time for our nation to change the character of our people, to encourage them to embrace the values of law and order above all else.
Unite Iran

Our rivals to the Iranian throne, left vacant after the demise of the Timurtash Empire, have been vanquished. We stand as the sole dominating power in Iran and it is up to us to pick up the pieces from the ruins left by decades of internecine conflict. Where there was once war and hatred, we shall have to rebuild peace and reconciliation.
Iranshahr Reborn

Now that Iran is united, from Kabulestan to Mesopotamia, from the Kopet Dag to Makran, our great dynasty can now undisputedly claim the title of legacy of our great predecessors - Cyrus the Great, Mithridates II, Shapur I. Long live the Shahanshah- the King of Kings!
Legacy of Timur

Kerman is the last territory held by the heirs of Timur in Persia. The Qajar and other vultures have challenged the claims of the rightful Shahanshah but now we have retaken Khuzestan from the Iraqis we can make them acknowledge our prominence!
Liquor Prohibition

The Temperance League, bold from many perceived victories against the uses and abuses of alchohol in our nation, are lobbying political decision makers to enact a nation wide ban on the sale, use and possession of alcoholic beverages. While opponents argue that prohibition threatens to turn the alcohol market into a lucrative business for organized crime, the Temperance League, on the contrary, argues that alcohol is in fact the root cause of many social ills, not least of which is, indeed, crime.
Repeal Prohibition
Some say that our nations's experiment with the outlawing of alcohol has gone on for too long, and argue that it should be abolished.
National Banking Act

While our government has for some time maintained a central bank, some voices within the economic debate have begun arguing in favor of monopolizing the issuing of currency to a strict government prerogative. Proponents argue that this will lead to an increase in economic stability, while opponents see it as a fundamental breach of the freedom of trade.
Enact Woman's Suffrage

The idea of Woman's Suffrage increasingly gained traction in Western society throughout the 19th century. First advocated in the writings of early liberal philosophers, such as England's Mary Woolstonecraft or John Stuart Mill, the idea and ideology of Woman's Suffrage gradually developed, as the century wore on, into a coherent ideology in its own right: Feminism. The experience during The First World War, of women working in factories, and other jobs previously reserved for men during peacetime, is often said to have been a crucial pivot point in securing Woman's right to work, vote, and, in other fields of society, achieve legal equality with men.
Form Rajputana
We must unite the Rajput people under a single flag, to better resist the Imperialists from incursions into India.
Reclaim Granada from the Savages!

We have been humiliated again and again by the Incan savages. They have managed to conquer half of our great nation. Their atrocities cannot go unpunished! It is time we beat them back and reclaim our great nation!
Form Granada
We have managed to unite the former Spanish colonies in Ameriga. We can now proclaim the state of Granada.
Rohnnst Indians

When the Cree people mixed with the Chinese of Qingqiu and Vinlandic Scandinavians, a new race was born - the Rohnnst. They traded with the colonizers and after long and extensive contact with them they formed a proto-state in the middle of the wild Arcadian plains and forests. But the march of civilization is endless and they have to make a decision today. Will they accept our hegemony?
Rohnnst Indians

When the Cree people mixed with the Chinese of Qingqiu and Vinlandic Scandinavians, a new race was born - the Rohnnst. They traded with the colonizers and after long and extensive contact with them they formed a proto-state in the middle of the wild Arcadian plains and forests. But the march of civilization is endless and they have to make a decision today. Will they accept our hegemony?
Integration of the Rohnst
Our policy of integrating the native peoples of Arcadia in our state must extend to the Rohnst who are closer to us than most of the other tribes!
Integration of the Iroquois

The Iroquois people are numberous in the Great Lakes region. We have had a mxied relationship with the old Confederation but with steps taken to integrate the tribes into our social fabric we can make them accept our rule
Integration of the Algonquin

The Algonquin tribes are the second largest native people in Vinland behind the Iroquois. Despite being organized in small tribes, they have acquired a common conscience over the years because of the colonization of their lands. With our policy towards the natives hinted at collaboration we can negotiate with them to make them full Vinlandic citizens
The Tribes from the Plains

The Great Plains of Arcadia are inhabited by the Sioux people, divided between the Nakota, Lakota and Dakota tribes. Their territory is challenged by many different states and we could enforce our claims by making the Sioux full citizens of our country.
Integration of the Cherokee

The Cherokee, or Tsalagi in their own language, are the Native people with whom the Dual-Monarchy had the most contacts. The Kingdom of Plantagenia ended their independence but the Cherokee never forgot their very culture. Proposals have emerged in Nouvelle-Orleans to make a special Cherokee act that would grant full citizenship to the tribes from the Montagnes Enfumees.
Integration of the Cunmin

The Cunmin tribes were the prime trade partners of the early Dong Guo city states and differentiated themselves from the many other Native tribes the Chinese settlers met by living in villages hence their name which mean 'Villagers', more commonly known as Pueblo because of Spanish conquistadors. As the Federation expands east it controls more and more of their territory and some of the politicians of Sanbao have suggested that we should grant them full citizenship to strenghten our rule on the Wild East.
Integration of the Apache

Spanish colonization of Ameriga and Southern Arcadia integrated the Native elites in the colonial system granting nobility title to the most Hispanicized. But in the northern parts of Lusitania, the city social system did not exist and many encroachements between Lusitanian and Apache tribes erupted. With our control over the numerous Apache territories complete we can grant them citizenship and let them administrate thier territories in our name
Proclaim the Tsardom of all Russias
Our domination over the Eastern Slavs is complete, and the time has come to declare a single states of all the Russians. The Great Bear has finally risen, and now Europe shall fear us!
The Mongolian Protectorate

Our influence in Mongolia is such that we are in a position to pry the nation away from the Chinese and into our control. They would be our vassals, benefiting from protection against Chinese claims on their land.
Russian Ambitions In The West
If Russia is to become a great empire, we must determine how we are to deal with our strong neighbors.
Move The Capital To Nyenschantz

In the early 18th century, Mikhail the Great made great efforts to modernize and strengthen Muscovy. We should honor and continue his efforts by building a great city on the Baltic and making it our capital. Nyenschantz isn't ice-free all year, but it's easily defensible and already somewhat populated. Furthermore, it would allow our a greater degree of control over our new Baltic subjects, which could very well make integrating them easier.
Move The Capital To Rostov

Rostov is located at the mouth of the Don River and has easy access to the Black Sea. If we are to focus on expanding southwards, it would make an excellent capital, giving us easy access to the entire Mediterranean and opening up many opportunities for trade, diplomacy, and expansion. We would also be able to exert greater control over recently incorporated steppe peoples, which could very well make integrating them easier.
Integrate the Ruthenians
As our (somewhat) close cultural kin, the Ruthenians certainly deserve full political rights within our empire.
Integrate the Kazan Tatars
Push to the Syr Darya Basin

On the outer limits of Mawara an-Nahr lies the Syr Daria basin, running from the Aral Sea to the Ferghana valley. The Ferghana was an important, if distant, region throughout the history of the Timurtash, being home to flourishing villages of mixed Turkic-Persian population, productive agricultural land and exploitable mineral deposits. Moreover, the Ferghana was the Timurtash windows towards China, the essential stopping point in any trade coming from the Tarim Basin and leaving towards Khorasan. With Mawara an-Nahr as far as Sogidana securely under our control, the Syr Darya basin is the only piece missing of the puzzle.
Reinstate the Uzbek Bureaucracy

The cornerstone of Timurtash administration in Transoxiana, particularly in the more remote regions of Khwarezm and the Ferghana, was a dualistic military-civilian system relying on different subgroups of Uzbeks. On the one hand, the Mehters were regional leaders of the hereditary bureaucracy, drawn from among the sedentary Uzbeks, who were in charge of civil administration. On the other hand, the Qoshbegis were members of the Uzbek tribal aristocracy, largely semi-nomadic, and were in charge of mustering and leading military forces when the Timurtash Shahanshah embarked on a campaign. Now that Khwarezm and the Ferghana are back into our hands for the first time since the Dzunghar invasions, it is of utmost importance to integrate the Uzbeks back into the machinery of our state.
Revoke the Treaty of Karabakh

The Treaty of Karabakh, signed after the annihilation of Timurtash forces in the Caucasus, formally ceded the entirety of the Timurtash holdings in the Caucasus as well as the provinces of Luristan and Khuzestan in Western Iran. The Ottomans never managed to fully establish themselves in their newly-conquered territories - the Janissary Revolt made sure that the Turks also went through their own period of chaos and disintegration. The Timurtash Empire has since then recovered, and the pretenders who took advantage of the power vacuum left by our temporary fall from grace have been crushed. We are finally in a position to formally rebuke the farce of the Treaty of Karabakh and press claim to the lands in the Caucasus that were under Timurtash rule since the early XVI Century.
Integrate the Armenians

Armenians and Iranians have been culturally and politically intertwined since antiquity. Both peoples were once fire-worshippers and were ruled by the royal house of the Arsacids, although they would begin to drift appart with the irruption of the Sassanians in Iran, the adoption of Christianity by the Armenians and eventually the Arab conquest and conversion of Iran to Islam. Nevertheless, the Armenians were key intermediaries in trade with the West during the Timurtash era and the Armenian culture and worship of Apostolic Christianity was protected by the state. The fall of the Caucasus to the Ottomans saw the two brother peoples forcefully separated, but our recent military successes have brought Iranian administration back to Armenia. It's time to welcome back the Armenians into our realm as is due.
Reconquest of the Caucasus

Iranians have meddled in the Caucasus for centuries and the Caucasus has traditionally been the linchpin of Iranian power projection westwards. Lost to the Ottomans after the humiliating Treaty of Karabakh was signed, the loss of the Caucasus meant that there was no longer any strategic depth protecting the heartland of Ajam from foreign invasion, and the crossroads of Eurasian trade, hitherto closely controlled by Iran, slipped to the grasp of the enemy. It is of paramount importance to reconquer the Caucasus if we are to restore Iran to its past glory and finally dispell the ghosts of the Ottoman-Dzunghar invasions.
Rehabilitate the Nomadic Tribes

Our brutal policies of forced detribalisation have achieved their stated goal - completely erasing the nomadic tribes from the political life of Iran - albeit at a huge human cost. The Ilkhans and Ilbegs have become mere courtiers of our regime and have massively enriched from the co-option into the central state and their transformation from tribal chiefs into absentee landlords. This process has created an ever-widening gulf between the chiefs and their former tribespeople, tearing appart the bonds of tribal communality, and the common tribespeople have been pauperized into poor migrant workers. It is time to make amends with the former tribals and abolish the cruel forced sedentarisation - nomadism will be legalised, and the state will help diversifying nomadic economy to include seasonal cultivation in addition to pastoralism.
Instigate Revolt in Occitània

Occitània has always been a hotbed of unrest for the Plantagenet monarchy - always at the edge of the Empire, embracing Protestanism during the bloody Wars of Religion and now, with the advent of the age of Nationalism, showing signs of apprehension in the face of increasingly aggressive assimilationist policies by the Anglois. We must harness this disconent to our advantage and seize the opportunity to march into Occitània as the liberators of the Provençal people.
Abolish the Treaty of Selon

The Treaty of Selon, the protocol establishing the basis for relations between European Empires and the native states of the East Indies, was promulgated by us over a century ago in order to protect our trade monopoly in the Far East. This ageing treaty seems to have reached the end of its useful life, with Burgundy, the Dual Monarchy and Scandinavia repeatedly violating the terms of the agreement and annexing large tracts of lands in the Indies. It is finally time to declare the Treaty void and carve up the riches of the East before our rivals do.
Unite the Kurdish States

The Kurdish Emirates have remained a seperate political entities under constantly changing hegemons for centuries. Now, for the first time in history, the Kurdish states are more closely united than ever before, ruled by one of their own, removed from foreign control. The years of hardship that the Kurdish people had to endure during the Ottoman Civil War forged them into one people, bound together by the memories of the darkest days. Now it is time to formalise this union of the tribes and cast away the old seperations, so that a united Kurdistan may cement its place in the Middle East for the centuries to come.
Liberate Ardalan

The Emirate of Ardalan dates back in the medieval era and of the six great Kurdish Emirates it has always been the closest to the long-standing Persian rivals of the Ottoman Empire. After it has been greatly enlarged at the behest of the Ottoman Caliph to reduce Persian influence in the border regions, it has served as the frontier in the chaotic years to follow. As central authority in Konstantinye broke down, and the Shekbizin warlord rose in Persia, the Emir of Ardalan swore himself to his cause and defected from the Empire. Over the years it has been properly incorporated into the Shekbizin Empire, losing all the autonomy it once held. Now, that native Kurdish rule has been restored under united Kurdistan, it is time to properly integrate and remove the Persian influence over the eastern border of the Kurdish nation.
Liberate Mukriyan

After the Ottoman victory over its Persian rivals in the late XVIII century, the Emirate of Mukriyan has been greatly increased in size of power, with the goal of establishing it as a frontier against the Turkoman warlords in the Caucasus mountains. But as central authority in the Ottoman Empire collapsed and chaos erupted in Kurdistan as well as the entirety of Anatolia, no aid could be sent to the Emirate. The Turkoman conquests of the entire Caucasus could not be halted by what little authority remained in Mukriyan and thus it fell to the invaders. After many years it has been reclaimed by united Kurdistan and it is time to integrate it into the nation properly, as to remove any Turkoman influence that could grow there in the years of subjugation.
Reign in the Kuren Kurdistana Azad

The Kuren Kurdistana Azad has been an instrumential part in the liberation of Kurdistan. A militia of local Kurdish tribesmen, following leaders of little renown, bonding together to protect their villages and territories from plundering armies from within and beyond Kurdistan. Soon it would become the most powerful force within the Kurdish lands and even the Emirs would have to recognise their power. As time progressed and the movement began to notice its lack of purpose, it attempted to mingle with the traditional ruling elite of Kurdistan, while becoming increasingly unpopular with the farmers and commonfolk, as they would often pillage and occupy their land without retribution. Now we finally have reached a point where we have the ability to break the KKA's chokehold on the Emirates and restore order. But how are we to proceed?
Greater Kurdistan

The Kurdish nation has grown much in the last years, at last encompassing everything that has traditionally been recognised as part of it. But still the young nation thirsts for conquest and the lands surrounding are more than ripe for it. Many factions within the nation have different ideas and wishes for how Kurdistan is to expand its power and territory, ultimately to help the nation overcome its early tumultous years. With which faction shall we side?
Accept the Armenians

Just like the Assyrians, the Armenians constitute a large part of our nation's population. And while history has not been kind to both our people, we often engaged in conflict with each other, as we traditionally settled in direct neighbourhood. But these things shall remain in the past now and as Kurdistan establishes itself on the political stage of the Middle East, we could use the aid of our Christian inhabitants. At last the time has come to make peace between our people and grant the Armenians in our nation proper citizenship and the privileges that come with it.
Restore the Van Ironworks

Historically the Van region has been a regional center of metalworking for millenia. In centuries prior Kurdish weaponry from Van was known across the entire Middle East and it played a considerable role in the Ottoman-Persian Wars. After the years of chaos during the Ottoman Civil War, many workers had abandoned the mines and turned to substinance farming. Nowadays the mines and smithies lay vacant. If we ought to establish a burgeoining industry like the westerners, it would most certainly be of use to reopen the mines, so that they may supply the future smithies of the Kurdish nation.
Irrigate Northern Kurdistan

Northern Kurdistan is mostly comprised of semi-arid highlands, where proper farming is mostly done in the large river valleys. The mountains are used by semi-nomadic or settled farming communities, that lead their lifestock from mountainside to mountainside. Most agricultural activity exists in the shape of substinance farming, but in the more fertile areas, there is an increasing presence of cash crops, like cotton and silk. Now that we have improved our ability to construct and operate watersupplies, we can begin the tremendous project that will see the greening of the more arid and agriculturally unsuitable corners of the highlands. Our nation will no longer have to fear severe famines and greatly profit from the crops we can cultivate in much larger quantities.
Deal with the Guilds

Ottoman influence over Kurdistan was traditionally enacted through the military and the social contracts that existed between the Emirs and the Caliph. But economic control over the resources of our lands was ensured through the operation of the various Ottoman guilds, that controlled monopolies over a multitude of economic fields. Often lead by Christian or Turkish oligarchs, the guilds were ultimately used to channel resources and the fruits of Kurdish labour out of the region into the Imperial heartlands and the Balkan territories. Even as Ottoman political control has vanished, the guilds still operate on the basis, that their activities were not tied to the Ottoman state appartus and that their influence was too great to be disbanded through sheer force. It is no secret that the local guild heads still maintain their lucrative connections to the economic elite of the Empire. Even after years of independence, their exploitative activities continue and the young Kurdish states are robbed of their own ressources. Discontent with this has not just persisted in the elite, but is now even spreading in the lower classes. It is time that we deal with the question of the Guilds once and for all.
Reclaim the Mosul Vilayet

Mosul used to be the cornerstone of Turkish power projection into southern Mesopotamia and fell under the domains of Malik Faysal Jailil when the former Ottoman general rebelled against Konstantinye and declared an independend Kingdom of Iraq. Control over Mosul was, nevertheless, never exercised on the ground - the same chaos that had allowed Jailil to break free from the Ottoman centre precluded the pacification of a region where Kurdish brigands and Assyrian rebels wrecked havok. Recent improvements in our military organisation have now opened up the possibility of marching towards Mosul, a matter of strict national security to protect our Northern border against incursions from Syria and Eastern Anatolia.
Abolish the Szekely Privilege

The Szekelys are the descendents of Hungarian military settlers which were granted land along the Carpathians during the Middle Ages to help guard the Eastern frontier. In exchange for their service, the Szekelys have traditionally enjoyed complete tax exemptions in addition to internal administrative autonomy. Szekely society has been on decline for centuries, with many Szekelys voluntarily entering into serfdom in order to avoid military service. Moreover, in the modern age of conscript armies their function can be regarded as ceremonial at best, and most importantly the inability of non-Szekelys to purchase land inside of the Székelyföld is preventing the central government from fully exploiting the natural resources of the region. Abolishing the autonomy of the Székelyföld would solve this issue - although this move will certainly be met with fierce resistance.
The End of the Cattle Barons

In the aftermath of the Ottoman conquest of Hungary the great plains at the center of the Kingdom became a frontier region contested with the Holy Roman Empire. The frequent warfare resulted in the emigration of Hungarian farmers, turning the already scantly-fertile land into a fallow wasteland. Although no longer apt for agriculture, the plains became ideal grazing ground, an opportunity that the Ottomans soon seized by introducing large-scale cattle breeding. Although successful in reviving the economy of the region, cattle cash-crop economy has stunted the long-term economical development of the plains. It is time to finally modernise and diversify the Great Hungarian Plain and begin to exploit its natural resources to the fullest, even if that has to come at the expense of the cattle barons that have dominated it since the Ottoman times.
Declare the Equality of Cults

Hungary was an exception among the Ottoman conquests in Europe in the sense that, despite the destruction of the Church hierarchy, Islam did not fill the vacuum of the Roman church but rather Protestanism did. In Madjaristan, with the exception of the southernmost Sanjaks, and Transylvania the population soon converted to Reformed Christianity, and at times the independent-minded Princes of Transylvania even intervened on the side of Protestanism during the European Wars of Religion. The reconquest of Hungary by the Catholic Duke of Nitra has, however, seen the Protestant majority sidelined and a glass ceiling has ensured that the highest offices throughout the Kingdom are held by Catholics hailing form the former Imperial territories. Nevertheless, the sheer demographic weight of Protestanism makes this arrangement unsustainable in the long term, and reformists within Magyarorszag call for a Declaration of the Equality of Cults and the end of discrimination against non-Catholics.
Limit the Signeural Rights

Hungarian nobles still enjoy a wide charter of privileges over their subjects that has seen little change since the Late Middle Ages. Reform is now gaining increasing momentum within Liberal Magyar circles, who seek to alleviate the serfs of the crushing weight of signeural abuse. Prime among the proposals is to end the embarassing situation in Royal Hungary in which the expenses of the Diet, in spite of providing political representation exclusively for the land-owning Nobility, are borne by the plebeians, who practically enjoy no political rights. This and other measures should improve the conditions of the peasantry and thus strenghen Magyarorszag as a whole.
Emancipate the Peasantry

The peasants of Hungary live in a state of practical serfdom - although they are protected from signeural abuse by county courts, peasants are forbidden from owning land. Instead, they work fields under a hereditary tenure, for which they must pay their noble lords rent usually through labour, the so called robot, or in kind. If Hungary is to prosper in the modern age, the old feudal rural order must be torn down and replaced by one built on legal equality. Only then will the peasants be able to serve the Church and the Crown to their fullest potential.
Force the Concivilität in the Königsboden

The Golden Charter has protected the privileges of the Saxon settlers in Transylvania since the XIII Century - among them, the exclusive rights of the Saxons to own property within their autonomous territory, the Königsboden. This prescript has particluarly marginalised the second-largest ethnic group in the Königsboden, the Vlachs, who in recent decades have started to develop a national consciousness and now look to their brothers beyond the Carpathians for deliverance from their current status of political and legal disempowerment. Liberal circles within Hungarian politics now propose that the Golden Charter be amended to abolish the Saxon monopoly on property-owning rights and force through the Concivilität - the equality of citizenship for all nationalities within the Königsboden. Although such a move will be seen as a violation of ancestral rights by the Saxons, it would be a significant step towards shifting the loyalty of the Vlachs to the Hungarian state.
Recognise the Saxon Nation

The Transylvanian Saxons are the descendents of military colonists invited by Geza II to guard the eastern reaches of the Kingdom. Ever since then, the Saxons have played a prominent role in the economic and political life of Transylvania, and their autonomy and privileges has been protected by the Golden Charter. Nevertheless, the provisions of this document have been slowly revoked in recent years, removing the elements that were detrimental to the rights of the other peoples inhabiting the Königsboden. This has resulted in the alieanation of the Saxons from the central government, fearing that the centralisation efforts will lead to the dilution and eventual disappearance of the Saxon nation. If we are to assuage these fears, we must officially recognise the Saxon as a nation in the Hungarian constitution and enshrine the protection of Saxon culture, giving the Saxons full autonomy in education and making knowledge of the Saxon dialect a requirement to hold office within the Königsboden.
Integrate the Kunok

The onset of Reformation meant that once the Ottomans destroyed the hierarchy of the Church in Hungary, Protestanism filled the vacuum, thus limiting the penetration of Islam in Magyar society. The muslim community in Madjaristan was borne out of state-directed efforts to settle loyal subjects in the troublesome Hungarian frontier - although unlike earlier conquests, this time settlers came from nearby muslim Slav communities rather than Turks from far away Anatolia. The settling was never as effective as envisioned and, besides border fortresses, its impact was felt more acutely to the regions closest to Bosnia. This community, which soon Magyarised, was derisively labelled by Christian Hungarians as Kunok - Cumans, in association with the infamous nomads with a nefarious reputation in Hungarian historiography and popular culture. The Kunok have with time taken the term as their own, although they remain a marginalised society on the fringe of the Hungarian state and have suffered intense oppression since Indpendence. Our recent steps towards the secularisation of the state mean that we can no longer treat our Kunok brothers as foreigners in their own homeland.
Abolish the Saxon University

The Saxon University is the political body through which the Saxons govern their autonomous region within Transylvania, the Königsboden. Its existance as a self-governing body limits the reach of the Magyar state in Transylvania and thus our efforts to modernise the nation. If the situation is to change, and the Saxon provinces are to become truly integrated into Hungary, the Saxon University needs to be hollowed out of its current functions and turned into a mere Cultural Foundation. Saxon officials will be replaced with Magyars, the education curricula will be replaced to match that of Budapest and the Golden Charter, a medieval document establishing the legal privilege of the Saxons, will be declared null and void.
Magyarise the Vlachs

Vlach herders started to migrate into Transylvania in the XIIIth Century, first in the southern settlements in the County of Fogaras and progressively expanding northwards towards Marámaros by the beggining of the XV Century. The Turkish conquest of Hungary and the ensuing political chaos only served to accelerate this process, intensifying the Vlach colonisation of the hitherto majority Magyar Transylvania. What once was a land shared by Magyars and Saxons now had a third, disruptive component, particularly in the central and southern parts of the principality where the Vlachs represent a majority of the population. The presence of the Vlachs has become particularly troublesome in recent years in the face of an upsurge of pan-Romanian nationalism in the Principalities of Wallachia and Moldavia, which threaten the very integrity of our nation. We must impose the Magyar language on the Vlachs and convert them into loyal Hungarian citizens before the situation in Transylvania siprals beyond our control.
Magyarise the Kunok

The muslim community in Madjaristan was borne out of state-directed efforts by the Ottoman Empire to settle loyal subjects in the troublesome Hungarian frontier - although unlike earlier conquests, this time settlers came from nearby muslim Slav communities rather than Turks from far away Anatolia. The settling was never as effective as envisioned and, besides border fortresses, its impact was felt more acutely to the regions closest to Bosnia. This community, which soon Magyarised, was derisively labelled by Christian Hungarians as Kunok - Cumans, in association with the infamous nomads with a nefarious reputation in Hungarian historiography and popular culture. The Kunok have with time reclaimed this term, although they remain a marginalised society on the fringe of the Hungarian state. The region where the Kunok form a majority of the population, the so called Kunsag, are a hotbed of anti-state activity that threatens to destabilise the new Magyar nation. If our southern border is to be truly secure, and disasters like the Turkish conquest not to be repeated, the Kunok must be forced to become upright members of Magyar society and abandon their lowly culture.
Integrate the Vlachs

The Vlachs were left out during the drafting of the Transylvanian constitution and, indeed, they are not recognised as one of the three nations that constitute the federal Principality - the Magyars, the Szekely and the Saxons. Nevertheless the Vlachs are the largest minority in Transylvania, far outnumbering the Saxons and being close in numbers to the Magyars, making the current situation of political disenfranchisement and cultural repression untenable in the long run. If Transylvania is to survive as an independent polity, we must amend the constitution to recognise the Vlach nation and their status as equals to any other citizen of the Principality.
The Hungarian-Romanian Union

Transylvania has historically been a diverse region with a strong admixture of cultures - German, Magyar, Vlach - giving it its unique character. With the rise of pan-nationalist ideology in Europe, Transylvania now finds itself at the frontier between competing irredentisms, Hungarian and Romanian, which threaten to destroy the delicate cultural ecosystem of the Principality for the sake of national consolidation. An alternative path could stymie such a disaster - unite both peoples, Magyars and Wallachians, together in a polyglot state encompassing both sides of the Carpathians.
Dominate the South Slavs

The reconquest of the old borders of the medieval Kingdom of Croatia brought millions of slavic subjects under our rule - yet the conquest was incomplete, for the Serb people are now split by the Hungarian frontier. Irredentism runs high among the Serbs, who long not only for re-unification with their brothers in Bosnia and the Krajina but also dream of a Yugoslav state encompassing Croats and Bosniaks as well. In recent years increasingly effective agitation by Serb agents in Bosnia and Dalmatia has thwarted Hungarian attempts to pacify the countryside and establish proper administration of the area, and is now starting to spread northwards towards Slavonia and the Temesköz, thus endangering the heart of Hungary itself. The only solution is to unite the South Slavs on our own terms - annexing the remaning Serbian territory outside our realm and re-organising it as dependent territories of the Magyar state.
The Albanian Protectorate

Albania has survived in a precarious position ever since it attained independence from the Ottoman Empire, surrounded on all sides by enemies eager to partition the young state. Our expansion into the Balkan peninsula has allowed us to gain considerable economic and political infulence within Albania and steer the Albanian cabinet into pro-Hungarian policies that have kept our rivals in the region away from the Adriatic coast. The ministry of foreign affairs now propose to tighten the screws even harder on our quasi-vassal neighbour - establishing a formal protectorate in Albania, nominally to secure her integrity against her predatory neighbours, and trade our Albanian-populated territories in Montenegro and Serbia for the port city of Vlorë. Possession of Vlorë would remove the Achilles' heel of the Hungarian navy and ensure that, in case of conflict with our neighbours in the Italian peninsula, the Hungarian warships would not be bottled up in the Adriatic.
Ultimatum for Oltenia

We have foolishly watched by and allowed the union of the principalities of Wallachia and Moldavia into a state that by its very nature is pan-Romanian and anti-Magyar - and now the continued existance of a united Romanian state poses a mortal threat to Magyardom in the areas of Hungary that the Romanians unjustly claim. Romania must be torn down and dismantled into its component pieces, which in turn must be relegated to submission. First though, we need a justification to open hostilities with the Vlachs, and such a pretext might be found in Oltenia. This piece of land between the Danube and the Olt, conquered by the Árpád Kings from the Bulgarian Empire in the XIII Century, was only separated from the Hungarian Crown after the Ottoman conquest, by which point it was attached to Wallachia. The return of Oltenia will be unacceptable demand for Romania, therefore granting us a golden opportunity to wage war on our own terms.
Institutionalise Shari'a

Early on in Islamic history the limitations of Shari'a were recognised: neither the Quran nor the Hadiths were legalistic texts and only covered a small subset of crimes. Thus, in parallel developed a secular school of jurisprudence based on Feqh, the human interpretation of divine law, much more flexible and able to keep step with the evolving needs of Muslim society. Nevertheless, in recent years the pendulum has swung too far and Shari'a has been sidelined in favour of Western-style secular law in order to keep up with the momentum of the world. We believe that true resistance to the West won't be achieved by mimetisation, but rather through a return to purer Islamic tradition and the enshrining of Shari'a as the prime legal code of our state. Only then will we be able to purge the immorality, alienation and injustice which has led to us falling behind the West in the first place.
Restore Cholollan

Before the arrival of the Spanish Cholollan was a powerful regional centre and the most sacred city in the entirety of Mesoameriga, crowned as it was by the astounding Great Pyramid dedicated to Quetzalcoátl. The old city was nevertheless sacked by the Marqués del Valle, the pyramid was replaced by a church and eventually the settlement faded into oblivion, eclipsed by the Spanish-founded Puebla de Zaragoza. As heirs to the Tlaxcallan, we must reclaim the legacy of Cholollan - which was ruled by a pluralistic council in a time of absolute despots - and refound the city as the capital for Aztlan and as a statement for the future direction of the Nahua people.
Ally the Spanish

There's no question that the Spanish conquest was a cataclysmic event that turned the Mesoamerigan world upside down, sinking the Nahua from a position of power to one of servitude and forever banishing old beliefs into oblivion. Nevertheless, as much as some within Aztlan would like it to, the clock cannot be turned back and the facts on the ground are that the new Nahua state shares little similary with the one of old - the Caxtiltecantli, the Spaniards, are hopelessly intermingled with the Nahua and are even the majority in several regions around the valley of Mexico, and the Christian faith has a fervent following among the population regardless of ethnicity. Any steps towards a prosperous future cannot be taken alone, but in harmony with the Spaniards, who must be accepted as equals to the Nahua.
Overthrow the Cacicazgos

Our young republic has come a long way since its incepton, yet many challenges lay ahead of it as its neighbours time and again respond to its successes with hostility. There's only one possible solution: to protect Aztlan and its form of government, a cordon sanitaire must be established all around our border with friendly, like-minded republics which will join a loose confederation of Mesoamerigan states. This means that the old Cacicazgos, what the Spanish call the petty lords that rule over the less fortunate native Mesoamerigan peoples, will have to be brought to an end - by force, no doubt.
Restore Tenochtitlan

The defunct Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan was the greatest city of the New World prior to the Spanish invasion, a true bustling metropolis at the head of an Empire that dominated Mesoameriga. It was in Tenochtitlan where the Mexica people settled as migrants from the mythical lands of Aztlan and where, from a humble beggining of servitude to the Toltecs, the Nahua people rose to become overlords of the valley of Mexico and beyond. Nevertheless the great city was practically destroyed during the Spanish conquest and from the ruins of old Tenochtitlan the Spaniards built Mexico City, the centre of Castillian colonial oppression in the New World. With Mexico City now firmly under our control, it is an imperative that the ancestral home of the Mexica be reclaimed, Tenochtitlan refounded and, much like in ancient times, repopulate it with Nahua wanderers.
Liberate Lusitania

Sonora was the birthplace of the revolution that freed the Black man from the yoke imposed upon him by the Hacendados. Torn from their homeland and sold overseas to satisfy the greed of unscrupulous men, the ancestors of the Liberian people would weep at the sight of the new hope that the revolution has built – yet Liberians cannot take pride in their creation, for immediately outside of their frontiers the Black man still lives in fear of the whip. It was in Lusitania where slavery took the strongest root in colonial New Spain, and it will be in Lusitania where the first campaign to liberate the Afroarcadians once and for all will begin.
The Frankish Predicament

Having pushed our borders all the way to Tejas it is impossible not to look beyond the far side of the Xenebreiro river and see the condition in which the African slaves eke out a miserable existence in the Plantagenian and Septiman plantations. Although culturally distinct and speaking French and Burgundian creoles rather than Spanish or Portuguese, the Afro-Frankish are still our brothers and deserve unmitigated freedom just as much as we did. It is time to show the world that the Black man, who has broken his back in the plantations on southeastern Arcadia for generations, will now take the reins and bring equality to the continent – by expanding the frontiers of Liberia, the only guarantor of freedom for the Afroarcadian.
Spread the Revolution to the Caribbean

The Caribbean was the first part of the New World to be colonised by the Europeans, and the first where African slaves were brought in to work in plantations after the native Indians had been worked to death. By and large, it was also one of the most dreadful destinations for a new slave being transported to Arcadia, the conditions on the sugar plantations being so brutal that it was more profitable for slave owners to continuously import new men rather than care for the existing workforce. It is our moral imperative then to free the last remaining Afroarcadians working in the West Indies and finally put to an end this centuries-long atrocity.
The Rebirth of Equinoxie

The short-lived Republic of Equinoxie was an idealist movement based on the equality of all men regardless of race, much like ours, and fought against the federal Amazonian government for the abolition of slavery. The struggle was unfortunately lost, and although slavery was technically abolished a decade later by Amazonie, the Afroamerigans still live in a state of legalised apartheid. We must send an expedition to revive the Equinoxean dream and bring true freedom to the oppressed Afro-Frankish people.
The Conquest of Coatzacoalcos

Coatzacoalcos has been for many centuries a key trade entrepot connecting the inland regions through its namesake river with the Mexican gulf and the coastal plains of Veracruz. In spite of its marshy environs, Coatzacoalcos has been populated since the time of the Olmecs and plays a prominent role in Aztec mythology, being the final departure place from which the god Quetzalcoatl sailed into the sea on a raft made from snake skin. Nowadays it is home to a substantial Nahua population, descendant of ancient Mexica settlers, which unfortunately still live marginalised in a criollo ethnostate. Though we were unable to liberate our brothers in the state of Veracruz during the Caste War, we can now amend our past failings and turn Coatzacoalcos into our window to the sea.
Expell the Spanish

Today, more than ever since the cataclysmic Conquest, the Spaniards pose a dire threat for the future of Nahua society. It is precisely now, after centuries of treading a long tortuous path of recovery from the XVI Century demographic collapse, that the descendants of the Castilian conquistadores have started to push out from the cities and flooded the countryside, where they are outcompeting local Nahua for the increasingly-scarce fertile land. This development has been a growing concern for decades, though one factor has changed – whereas under the governments of New Spain or Gran Colombia rural colonisation was encouraged, the Nahua now find themselves sovereign rulers over their own lands once more. Acknowledging that the demographic pressure in the cities is untenable, our government proposes a harsh yet necessary solution: to expel the Spanish surplus population North into the colonial states of Jalisco and Lusitania.
The Legacy the Aztec Empire

The rise of the Aztec Empire was a watershed event in Mesoamerigan history, bringing a new scale of Empire building priorly unseen in Mexico. Whereas Mesoamerigan conquest states were usually formed by a city extracting tribute from other city states in their immediate periphery, the Aztecs brought a new level of organisation to the table by establishing the Triple Alliance between the cities of Tenochtitlan, Texcoco and Tlacopan, and managed to expand their tributary network outside of the Basin of Mexico as far away as the fringes of the Maya world in the Pacific slopes of the Istatan Mountains. Such expansion led to the establishment of sizeable Nahua communities in the former territory of the Triple Alliance – our close cultural kin which, unfortunately, remained under foreign rule after the Caste War. By reviving the legacy of the Aztec Empire and reconquering the land ruled by our forefathers, we will liberate our brothers and elevate the Nahuatl people everywhere to the position they deserve.
Abolish the Siete Partidas

Since independence Huasteca has maintained the lion’s share of Spanish colonial legislation, only making ad-hoc change when necessary. One of the most jarring leftovers of colonial law is that based on the Siete Partidas, a XIII Century Castillian book concerning all areas of civil law. Notably the Siete Partidas categorises women - together with children, criminals and invalids – as in need of male supervision in legal and economic matters. This infringement on woman’s autonomy effectively means that they are subject to the will of their closest male relatives until marriage, and is completely at cross-purposes with the traditional matriarchal values of Huastec society. It is time to repeal the Siete Partidas and write a new statutory code in accordance to our cultural values.
Reform the League of Mayapan

The League of Mayapan was the last great polity to dominate the Maya world, being founded in the XII century as a confederation of the cities of Uxmal, Chichén Itzá and Mayapan, the namesake, dominating member and capital of the League. Mayapan was the last hurrah of the Maya people before the Spanish conquest, a rebirth of cultural and economic splendour of the Classical period before factionalism, famine and mass flight resulted in the collapse of the confederation. The dissolution of the League of Mayapan and the subsequent fragmentation of the Maya world into a mosaic of weak city states facilitated colonisation by the Castilian conquerors – a tragedy from which we must learn. In order to ensure that the Maya never again become subjects to a foreign colonial power we must refound the League of Mayapan on the basis of equality for all provinces.
Fund an Expedition to the Lost Maya Cities

The great cities of Uxmal, Chichén Itzá and Mayapan, the three leading members of the League of Mayapan, used to dominate Yucatán and the Maya world, yet their exact locations have been lost to time since the Castilian conquest and the collapse of the pre-contact society. It would greatly increase our status in the eyes of Western powers if we could reclaim our cultural heritage and find the ruins of the three capitals of Mayapan, rehabilitating their spaces so that the world can admire the achievements of our forefathers – and in the process, diversify and reinforce the economy of the rugged Yucatecan provinces.
Break the Divine Cast

Hacendados are the rot that is eating Mayapan from the inside – surreptitiously increasing their acreage and expanding their haciendas to their point where their influence rivals that of the state in the henequen-producing regions. Their political network has until the present prevented the Congress from enacting legislation to end indebted servitude, a shameful form of peonage in which a large percentage of Yucatecans have fallen in the past decades, creating a paradoxical situation where Yucatán is home both to the most destitute members of Maya society as well as the highest concentration of millionaires in all of Mesoameriga. The situation has reached a point where it is endangering the security of Mayapan itself, for indentured serfs are exempt from conscription into the federal army. We must break the ‘Divine Caste’ of the Hacendados and re-establish proper social order in the land of the Green Gold.
The Transpeninsular Railroad

Transportation in the Yucatán peninsula still largely uses the same means that were introduced during the Spanish conquest centuries ago – mules traveling on dirt tracks prone to be washed away seasonally. The lack of a proper transportation infrastructure hampers commercial exchange between the far-flung production centres of the peninsula and greatly reduces the already narrow profit margins that local producers can make. The current government has proposed an ambitious solution to the problem: to connect the major population centres of Yucatán through wide-gauge railroad tracks, which would in turn be serviced by narrow-gage feeder tracks to connect the countryside with the cities, thus revitalising commerce and development along the path of the rail tracks. Such an enterprise must necessarily include an overhaul of the port facilities at Sisal, which is to become the end terminus for good transportation and the starting point for export across the sea.
Abolish the Office of Batab

The Batabs, the Maya caciques, are an ancient institution that has festered for centuries. Their role was already defined in pre-colonial times: primarily collection of tribute, though the administration of justice, organisation of labour drafts and the scrutiny of the moral conduct of the peasants were also among the expected tasks of a Batab. Originally under the supervision of regional chiefs, the Halac Uinich, such accountability was lost after the Spanish conquest, at which point the Batabs became petty lords on their own who paid tribute directly to the Castilian crown. Since then the office of Batab has become a synonym for corruption, embezzlement and ruthless exploitation of the Maya peasantry, and the perseverance of the tribute economy has kept Maya society underproductive and underdeveloped. It is time to finally abolish the office of Batab and bring modern, non-rapacious bureaucracy to the villages so that the Maya peasant may finally rise above subsistence and a proper export economy may be developed.
Rehabilitate La Valenciana

The mine of La Valenciana, located in the province of Guanajuato, was just half a century ago the world’s most prolific source of gold and silver, accounting for approximately three quarters of the world’s total production of precious metals. Nevertheless, La Valenciana has seen better days – its machinery was damaged during the Colombian War of Independence, and a later flood rendered most of its galleries completely inaccessible. Our recent advances in pump technology have seemingly given La Valenciana a second chance: by investing in the rehabilitation of the mines and the repair of its facilities, we could tap into the vast mineral reserves that once fed the Spanish Empire.
Irrigate the Mezquital Valley

With the onset of Spanish system many Otomi turned to semi-nomadic pastoralism as a way to escape the cruel encomienda system being implemented in the fertile farmlands. The Otomi in the Mezquital valley still follow this lifestyle, combining sheep herding in the arid slopes of the Sierra Alta with seasonal cultivation of maguey. Nevertheless, with the recovery of indigenous population to pre-conquest levels this lifestyle is breaking down as the available water supply has become inadequate to sustain the growing communities. A solution to this conundrum may be found through an understanding with the government of Mexico City, which is considering how to drain lake Texcoco. The lake has for centuries been the sewage of the city and the source of endless epidemics each time a flooding episode brought the refuse back to the metropolis. By collaborating with the Mexicans and building a canal connecting lake Texococo with the Tula river, we would be able to use the blackwater to irrigate and fertilise the Mesquital valley and revitalise its economy.
The Spoils of Huayacocotlan

As allies of the Spanish the Otomi participated in the wars of conquest in the chaotic years following the fall of the Triple Alliance. One such venture was the expedition to subjugate Huayacocotlan, and independent principality which had never bowed to the Aztecs and was opposing bitter resistance to the Conquistadores. In the ensuing campaign not only would Huayacocotlan be conquered but, in a brutal pacification campaign, the Otomi would also aid the Spanish in the crushing of all the remaining independent indigenous centres up to the coast, from the Huasteca to the Totonac lands. We must now claim what’s rightfully ours - the spoils of conquest that the Spanish gained through the spilling of Otomi blood.
The Otomi-Spanish Kinship

The Otomi have always had a difficult relation with the Spanish, being allies during the conquest yet being marginalised after the guns fell silent, being encouraged to settle in the pacified Chichimeca lands yet mercilessly thrown into the encomienda system. Nonetheless the line between criollo Mexican and Otomi is as blurry as it has ever been – a large percentage of ethnic Otomi who were displaced during the Conquest have lost their tribal affiliation and forgotten their ancestral language and, with it, their identity. The descendants of the Otomi warriors of old are now speakers of Castilian and have for generations been loyal citizens of the Viceroyalty of New Spain, and if we are to accept them back into our fold, we must make an effort to forgive and integrate the Spanish at large.
Expell the Caciques

In the aftermath of the War of Emancipation a power vacuum appeared in the remote Otomí villages which was soon exploited by ambitious warlords who soon became a powerful caste. These armed caciques have effectively become a state within a state and indispensable intermediaries in any interaction between the Otomí Confederation and its unfortunate citizens. The existing status quo not only results in inefficient tax collection – for as long as the caciques are petty kings over their villages, the villagers are disenfranchised, elections being no more than shams in which the results are enforced through coercion, and the peasants live miserable lives of exploitation. If the Otomi Confederation is to become a legitimate state, the caciques must be expelled from the villages.
Disempower the Cargo System

The cargo system has been ruthlessly exploited by the clergy to exploit the Otomi peasantry. Although the cargo system is a traditional part of village life and under normal circumstances a healthy instrument to conduct political activity in the countryside, its hijacking to enrich the Church at the expense of the villager’s prosperity has marked it for abolition. We must reform the administration of the villages to increase the reach of the state and make sure that political power is not gained through service in the religious hierarchy but rather through election by the citizens.
Make a Move Against Eneedzaa

Calixto Chapital, the self-crowned King of the Mixes, has had to rely on the cacique Eneedzaa to enforce his rule – being a former Spanish official of Mestizo origin, his legitimacy was very much in question in the first years after his accession to the throne. Eneedzaa has never contented himself with is position as Minister of Development and has slowly built up a powerbase to rival that of King Chapital. The more the power of the cacique grew, the less useful his formal prostration to the royal house was, to the point where a violent overthrow might be soon forthcoming. We must strike first and deal with the cacique from a position of advantage.
Free the Zoque

Zoque is the closest language to Mixe and both are believed to descend from a common ancestor most likely spoken by the legendary Olmecs, the mother culture of Mesoamerigan civilisation. Whereas the Mixe people have managed to achieve emancipation and independence, the Zoque still live under foreign rule, being geographically fragmented and living in the unproductive jungle of Chimalapas. It is a moral imperative that we free our brothers from the Maya Batabo'ob that oppress and exploit them and embrace the Zoque people into our state.
Heirs to the Olmecs

Although over the centuries the Mixe people have been reduced to a small strip of territory in the northern mountains of Oaxaca, this is but the remnant of a past full of glory – the Mixe are after all the last remnants of the Olmecs, the first great civilisation of Mesoameriga. The Olmec homeland was not the current Mixe region, but rather the swampy coastal plain of Tuxtla, where nowadays the native peoples are outnumbered by Castilian colonists. Though the Olmecs may be known in western literature largely for their colossal basalt head sculptures, their most enduring legacy is in the field of ideology – the Olmecs were the first to set up a system of religious legitimisation for royal political power which went on to serve as the blueprint for future Mesoamerigan polities. As heirs to the legacy of the Olmecs, we must make ourselves worthy of our prestigious ancestors and reclaim the old Olmec homeland.
Reclaim the Zapotec Heritage

The present city of Oaxaca is a symbol of historical submission for the Zapotec people – first established as Huaxyacac by the Aztecs as a garrison town in an attempt to incorporate the Zapotecs into their Empire, and later by the Spanish as the colonial administration centre of the region. With the rebirth of an independent Zapotec state, we must reclaim the heritage of the Zaadxil dynasty, who first bitterly resisted Aztec attempts to establish a land corridor to Guatemala through Zapotec lands and later on would try to oppose the Castillian conquistadores and their Mixtec allies. We must rehabilitate the twin centres of power of the Zaadxil dynasty – the namesake city of Zaadxil, the former political centre of the region, as well as Lyobaa, the religious centre of the Zapotecs. Zaadxil shall be rebuilt from the measly villa it is today into a worthy capital whereas Lyobaa, nowadays no more than a pile of half-buried ruins, shall become the centre from which Zapotec culture will experience its rebirth.
Revitalise the Carmine Dye Economy

The Carmine dye has a most unique method of production – the Cochineal insect infect their host, the Nopal cactus, and ingests the cactus’ juices which when mixed with its stomachal acids become carminic acid. For centuries the Carmine cochineal dye had been the Zapotec’s most valuable export, though in the post-colonial period this industry has sharply declined. During viceroyal times Zapotec farmers became reliant on the capital of criollo mayors to finance the purchase of cochineal bugs, and their disappearance during the brief Gran Colombian period sounded the toll for dye production. As the newly independent Zapotec state, we must take on the role of financing the purchase of Cochineal to revitalise the export of carmine dye and stimulate the growth of an indigenous self-reliant textile industry.
Restore Dani Baan

The Kingdom of Dani Baan represents the Zenith of Zapotec political expression in the pre-conquest period. Named after its capital, strategically located on the slopes of a hill dominating the Oaxaca Valley, Dani Baan managed to subjugate its neighbours and establish an Empire stretching to the Mixtec lands in the West. Some of its impressive monumental architecture has managed to survive to the present day, its pyramids and stepped platforms built on hilltops still reminding the inhabitants of the valleys of the power that Dani Baan once held. We must prove ourselves worthy of our ancestor’s glory, turn these memories of Zapotec dominance into reality and reclaim the lands once ruled by Dani Baan.
Liberate Ñuu I'ni

Though in the aftermath of the War of Emancipation the Mixtec managed to carve out a nation state comprising of most Mixtec-majority areas, there is still a substantial amount of our brethren living under foreign rule. During negotiations with the other partners of the League of Cemanahuac the Mixtec delegation exacted an assurance by the Nahua that the Mixtec minorities in Aztlan would be protected – assurances which have proven to be no more than hollow promises. If Mixtec culture is to continue to survive in Ñuu I’ni, what the Spanish call Mixteca Baja, we have no option but to incorporate this region into our state.
Repair the Coo Yuu System

The Mixtec lands are hardly the most fertile in Mesoameriga – rugged and subject to long rainless dry seasons, only through the sheer ingenuity of the Mixtecs have they been able to support an agrarian society. The Mixtec solution to their geographical situation was the Coo Yuu, a system in which valley slopes and ravines were terraced to capture naturally-flowing rainwater to prevent desiccation during drought.  The Coo Yuu nevertheless requires maintenance, which was sorely lacking in the tumultuous years of the Wars of Independence and Emancipation. Nowadays the Coo Yuu system lays largely in a state of disrepair, endangering the food security of the growing Mixtec population. We must invest in repairs of the terraces and extend the system throughout the country before the crisis spirals out of control.
Restore Yucu Dzaa

The Mixtecs can look to the past with pride – the achievements and conquests of ‘8 Deer Jaguar Claw’, a XII Century Mixtec warlord who managed for the first and only time in history to unite all the Mixtec city states, are unparalleled in Mesoamerigan history. Though the state founded by 8 Deer would irreversibly shrink after his death, it endured as an independent polity centred around Yucu Dzaa which fiercely resisted Aztec expansionism until its final downfall at the hands of the Spanish conquistadores. As the heirs to this illustrious tradition, we must reclaim our martial past and restore Mixtec rule over the former lands of Yucu Dzaa.
Reunify Totonacapan

The Totonac people were once masters of the Gulf Coast, dominating the plains from the arid northern frontier to the edge of the Maya world and the slopes of Sierra Madre Oriental. Successive foreign invasions would break Totonac power – first the Toltecs, who would go on to establish a powerful Empire in the valley of Mexico, and later on the Chichimec, who boxed in the Totonac people to their current borders. We must reclaim what once was ours and reestablish the rule of Totonacapan over the Gulf Coast.
Rebuild the Three Hearts

The very name of the Totonacs means three hearts after the three classic cultural centres of Totonacapan – Tajin, Cempoala and Teayo. From these cities the Totonacs extended their influence across the present-day state of Veracruz, acquiring great wealth which was invested in the construction of monumental pyramids such as that of Tajin with an unparalleled design in Mesoamerigan architecture. Though Tajin and Teayo were already deserted by the time the Spanish arrived, Cempoala and neighbouring settlements were still vibrant communities at the time of conquest, though the ravages of the plagues brought by Europeans eventually also led to their abandonment. With Totonac power once more on the rise, we are now in a position honour our name and rebuild the three hearts of Totonacapan.
Beyond the Vanilla Trade

The shift of vanilla production away from Totonacapan towards the European colonies in the Indopacific has caused a decline of the economic activity of our nation. If Totonacapan is to ever become prosperous gain, we must shift away our focus to alternative industries. In that context some of the reports from prospectors are promising – some rich deposits of gold have been discovered near Zomelahuacan and the copper mines of Teziutlán, which had closed down shortly after the Colombian Revolution due to economic failure, might yet again turn a profit if its mining equipment is brought up to modern drilling standards.
Return to Teotihuacan

The Totonacs were once masters of one of the jewels of Mesoameriga – Teotihuacan, a great metropolis which at its zenith was home to 150000 citizens, the greatest concentration of urban dwellers in the Western Hemisphere. Though Teotihuacan for centuries dominated Mesoameriga, on the VII Century it suffered from a mysterious sudden collapse, and nowadays no more than a few pyramid mounds remain near the Avenue of the Dead. With the fall of Teotihuacan, the memory of Totonac supremacy also faded into oblivion, erased by the later Nahua migration and the rise of the Aztecs. It is time to return the Totonac people to their rightful place in Mesoameriga and return to the Valley of Mexico.
Reform the League of Cemanahuac

The past decades have seen the rebirth of Mesoamerigan sovereignty after three centuries of conquest and colonisation by the Spanish. And though we must pride ourselves of this watershed moment in the history of the native peoples of the New World, this newfound freedom is fragile and threatened on all sides by European imperialists and their descendants who would wish to erase this dangerous precedent. As the dominant power in Mesoameriga, it is our duty to reorganise the fragmented native lands into a united federation - the League of Cemanahuac, reborn once more as a bulwark of indigenous freedom!
